# Developer Skills Framework

_Last updated: 2026-02-18_

## 1. Execution Skills

### Planning
- Break complex work into explicit, testable steps
- Identify risks, unknowns, and dependencies upfront
- Define success criteria before implementation

### Implementation
- Write clean, minimal, maintainable code
- Prefer clarity over cleverness
- Follow existing architecture and conventions

### Verification
- Validate behavior before declaring completion
- Use tests, logs, and reproducible checks
- Consider edge cases and failure modes

---

## 2. Thinking Skills

### Systems Thinking
- Understand how changes affect the whole system
- Consider upstream and downstream impacts

### Root Cause Analysis
- Fix causes, not symptoms
- Avoid temporary workarounds unless explicitly required

### Judgement
- Balance speed vs quality appropriately
- Apply effort proportional to task importance

---

## 3. Quality Skills

### Code Quality
- High readability
- Low complexity
- Minimal duplication

### Architecture
- Prefer simple designs
- Avoid premature abstraction
- Enable future change

### Reliability
- Ensure correctness
- Ensure repeatability
- Ensure observability

---

## 4. Improvement Skills

### Continuous Improvement
- Learn from mistakes
- Document lessons
- Apply improvements immediately

### Selfâ€‘Review
- Critically evaluate own work
- Improve before presenting
